meanings.definition: The quality or state of being narrow.
meanings.sent1: The narrowness of the hallway made it difficult for two people to walk side by side.
meanings.sent2: The narrowness of the road caused traffic congestion during rush hour.
meanings.sent3: The narrowness of the elevator led to some comical situations when people tried to fit in with their large bags.
meanings.sent4: The narrowness of her focus on work was like a tunnel vision, ignoring everything else around her.
meanings.sent5: The narrowness of the bridge railing made her feel uneasy as she crossed over the river.

meanings.sent1: The narrowness of the cave entrance required them to crawl through one by one.
meanings.sent2: The narrowness of the alley made it a perfect spot for hide and seek.
meanings.sent3: The narrowness of the doorway made it challenging for the delivery person to bring in the large package.
meanings.sent4: The narrowness of the gap between the buildings created a unique urban landscape.
meanings.sent5: The narrowness of the path through the forest added an element of adventure to their hike.
